channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for TN

The red tote was delivered to QA cage for further inspection. DescribePack: 1 of 4 1-gallon bottle had a loose causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: When the package was found leaking, it was placed in a hazardous bag and into a red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023071215
item.description:
Report X-2023071215

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-17
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: NASH admin discovered a leaking fiberboard box on the flexslide. Admin did not initially suspect this was a hazardous material as there were no diamond labels or hazmat paperwork attached to the packaging. Gloves were donned and package with all absorbed spillage was placed in a double-lined tote/bin and transported to the HMPA for further investigation. Pictures of the original packaging were found on Spidr. The shipper TRU VALUE/PROMAX could not verify the presence of a hazmat or whether content was (as stated on original packaging) six 1 gallon plastic bottles of Rooto 10% Ammonia; their SDS service through Ambipar could not provide any details of Section 14 of the SDS provided. In the shipper's SDS Section 14, all descriptors (except for PG: III) were listed as NA. The manufacturer Rooto Corp provided admin with an SDS Section 14 that described the material as UN2672, Ammonia solution, 8 III. PGH was kept informed of all developments. As the shipper could not verify content or presence of a hazmat, ERTS was called to verify the material and transfer all spillage to a drum. Constant ventilation was provided during this process. DescribePack: One of six 1gal bottles lost 0.7 gallon due to a loose cap closure. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE was donned. The package and all spillage was placed in a double-lined, lidded tote and moved under ventilation for further investigation. As the shipper could not verify content or presence of a hazmat, ERTS was called to verify the material and transfer all spillage to a drum. Constant ventilation was provided during this process.

item.title: Report X-2023070173
item.description:
Report X-2023070173

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-16T06:13:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-01
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 7/1/2023 at approximately 1115, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 658069 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a comsumer commodity spill. The shipment consisted of 5 Fiberboard box pieces , one packed with 18 bottles fo perfume, in which 2 bottles leaked from being broken. The cause of the damage is unknown. The damaged pieces awaits disposal and the remianing contents were placed in a salvage drum and await an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

item.title: Report X-2023071147
item.description:
Report X-2023071147

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-16
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2023071147 SequenceEvent: contents arrived in a damage state. The box has leakage damage from interior contents causing item to be undeliverable. Once picked up from unload area by QA, item was brought to be processed and handled in designated area. DescribePack: The content within the package had a loose top that didn't stay sealed, therefore causing the item to leak and deteriorate the box it was packaged in. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Contents were picked up by QA and brought over to the hazmat cage in a bucket to be processed and dealt with accordingly. 2. X-2023071150 SequenceEvent: Item was called out for QA to tend too. Once we arrived to grab damage, it was obvious the contents were leaking internally. Item was brought to the hazmat cage in a tote and tended too accordingly. DescribePack: Contents within shipping box had a missing cap. This allowed for leakage to occur and damage to be done to the item. The box used for shipping was warped to the point it was no longer sealed. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was contained in a tote and brought over to hazmat cage to be dealt with accordingly.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box found with no limited quantity diamond label, no diamond labels, no proper shipping name/UNPOP markings, or paperwork. Strong vinegar smell prompted immediate transport to HMPA. DescribePack: One of the two 1 gallon bottles of Harris 30% Vinegar Concentrate lost 0.8 gallon from loose cap closures despite zipped bag surrounding individual bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned, spillage absorbed, ventilation utilized, and SDS consulted.

item.title: Report X-2023061395
item.description:
Report X-2023061395

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-15T18:13:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-28
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Package was offered to our spill office located in our Memphis Hub location when it was seen package was leaking. Package consisted of a steel drum containing UN3082. It was seen upon arrival of spill cleanup agent that the top chime of the drum was damaged. It was not known how the damage to the drum occurred. It was also seen commodity was leaking from cap placed in bung hole allowing for an estimated 5L to spill. Package to be placed in a steel salvage drum and shipper is to be contacted for an amended shipper's declaration for return to shipper as FedEx Policy does not allow for international shipment of salvage drums.

Inner contents: Michel Germain (Sexual Paris Pour Homme, 75 ml), Michel Germain (Sexual Paris eau de parfum vaporisateur spray, 75 ml), Michel Germain (Sexual Noir eau de parfum, 75 ml), Michel Germain (Sugarful&Spice, eau de parfum, vaporisateur spray, 100 ml x 2, Michel France, Michel Germain x 2

item.title: Report X-2023061352
item.description:
Report X-2023061352

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-10T21:10:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 06/23/2023 at approximately 1330, Dangerous Goods Adminstration received a call from Employee 860829 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting a toxic substance spill. The shipment consisted of one metal drum. The drum was discovered with a pin-hole sized puncture near the bottom chime, resulting in leakage. The cause of the damage is unknown. The spillage was contained and the damaged container with the remaining contents was placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023070955
item.description:
Report X-2023070955

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-22
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Leaking fiberboard box containing a 5 gallon drum of Texas Stone Sealer TSSPRO-300 WetLook Sealer found on loadside. No diamond labels, proper shipping name, or hazmat paperwork present. Removed from operations. SDS requested from shipper, manufacturer, and acct executive through multiple phone calls and emails. DescribePack: One 5 gallon drum of Texas Stone Sealer TSSPRO-300 WetLook Sealer found to have lost approximately 1.2 gallons (35lb left of 43lb) through a loose lid closure. Drum lid design is removable. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: PPE donned. Until the material could be identified with the SDS provided by the Account Executive and Shipper, the material was placed in a lined and lidded tote which was under constant ventilation.

item.title: Report X-2023060841
item.description:
Report X-2023060841

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was dispatched to the North Input for a leaking drum. The agent was given a metal drum inside of a plastic bag an input employee placed the drum in the bag after noticing the leak. The removable lid was damaged causing the release. The package was ruled a loss and will be disposed of hazardous material at the location.
